page.title: 11RELIGION IN MARSHFIELD
page.content: There are two churches. The Hebron Hall has three Sunday services; morning and evening and Sunday School. The Parish Church of St. Mary the Virgin also has 3 Sunday services;8 am Holy Communion, 10.30 am Family or Communion Service, 6 pm Evensong. The first and third have the traditional form of worship. The Alternative Service Book is used at 10.30 am. The congregations at 8 am and 6 pm consist of the older people and at 10.30 am of younger families. During the week Holy Communion is held once a month at the Almshouses and Withymead Centre. The vicar, Rev. Michael Westlake, is also responsible for three other parishes. There is an ecumenical Bible Study Group which meets twice a month in private homes. Many villagers have links with churches, either in Bath or Chipping Sodbury.
